prompt: Facts: The appellant (Charan Singh) and the deceased (his wife) checked into Room No. 205, Pulimootil Tourist Home, Changanassery, Kerala on 14.01.2009 around 7:00 PM.; The appellant was last seen with the deceased in the said room.; Around 9:30-10:00 PM on 14.01.2009, the appellant left the lodge alone.; He informed the receptionist (PW-1) that his wife was sleeping, they would check out the next morning, and left the room key with PW-1.; On 15.01.2009, as the room remained locked from the inside and the occupants did not respond, PW-1 informed the manager (PW-2).; Police (PW-17, Investigating Officer) were informed, arrived, and broke open the room door.; The deceased was found lying dead on the bed inside the locked room.; FIR No. 29/2009 was registered at Changanassery Police Station based on the statement of PW-1.; Post-mortem examination (Ext. P9) conducted by PW-14 (doctor) concluded the cause of death was smothering.; Minor injuries (abrasions) were noted on the deceased's nose and upper lip, consistent with smothering.; The time of death estimated by PW-14 was consistent with the period after the appellant and deceased checked in and before the body was discovered.; The appellant was arrested on 16.01.2009 from Coimbatore Railway Station.; The prosecution alleged the motive was the appellant's suspicion regarding his wife's fidelity.; The Trial Court convicted the appellant under Section 302 IPC and sentenced him to life imprisonment.; The High Court of Kerala dismissed the appellant's appeal and confirmed the conviction and sentence.; The appellant appealed to the Supreme Court against the High Court's judgment. | IPC: Section 302 (Punishment for Murder), Section 300 (Murder - Definition, invoked for conviction under S.302)
